docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO. IN 1965 Berkeley was the axis of what was just beginning to be called the "New Left." Its leaders were radical, but they were also deeply committed to the society they wanted to change.

headline.main: The 'Hashbury' Is the Capital Of the Hippies; The "Hashbury" Is the Capital of the Hippies (Cont.)

docs.abstract: H S Thompson article on group, most of whom take drugs and subsist on little money; illus; pol apathy and alienation from soc noted
docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO. IN 1965 Berkeley was the axis of what was just beginning to be  called the "New Left." Its leaders were radical, but they were also deeply committed to the society they wanted to change.
